{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has lower natural teeth and 7 maxillary implants placed with a space of 15 mm for the restoration. This indicates that the patient has a significant amount of space for a prosthetic device. Single crowns and bridges, whether screw or cement retained, are typically used when there are only one or two missing teeth. An overdenture is a type of removable denture that is supported by and attached to implants, but it might not provide the stability needed for a large space. A hybrid denture, on the other hand, is a type of denture that is fixed into place with implants. It is designed to replace all the teeth in an arch, making it a suitable option for this case.", "answer_choice": "D. Hybrid denture"}
